page.title: 10PLAYTIME IN MARTON/NUNTHORPE
page.content: A survey of children at Captain Cook Junior School found the most popular game in the school-yard to be{ {'runacross'.}This game is where one person is 'on' and the rest of the children are all inside a safe area at one side of the yard. The person 'on' shouts "Runacross!" and all the children run across the yard to a safe area on the opposite side. You do this until the person 'on' manages to 'tag' someone, they too are now 'on'. The children 'on' keep on tagging until there is only one person left and he is the winner. The game then starts all over again with the person tagged first 'on'. The next most popular yard game was{'skips'}this being played mostly by the girls. The ever popular {'marbles'}came third. For play out of school times there are play areas, but most children think these inadequate.
